mean.noun: a person or thing that accumulates things.
the action or process of adding something to something else.

synonym.noun: adding, incorporation, inclusion, introduction supplement, adjunct, addendum, adhesion, appendage, add-on, extra, attachment, rider, appurtenance accession        increase, gain        plus, summation        improver, add-on

words.example: Such a machine would be able to carry out complex operations using only the mechanism for addition .

mean.noun: the particulars of the place where someone lives or an organization is situated.
mean.verb: write the name and address of the intended recipient on (an envelope, letter, or package).

synonym.noun: inscription, house, speech, reference, savoir-faire, name and address
synonym.verb: talk to, give a talk to, speak to, make a speech to, give a lecture to, lecture, hold forth to, preach to, give a sermon to, buttonhole, collar

words.example: That way, when I address the ball, the leaf or patch of grass is still in my peripheral vision and can remind me where my target is.

mean.verb: take (something) for one's own use, typically without the owner's permission.
mean.adjective: suitable or proper in the circumstances.

synonym.verb: seize, steal, plagiarize, allocate, capture, allow

mean.noun: the branch of mathematics dealing with the properties and manipulation of numbers.

words.example: Malthus suggested that the world's population, growing at a geometric rate, was increasing at a much faster rate than the world's food production, which only increased arithmetically .

synonym.noun: ability, capacity, power, potential, competence, proficiency, adeptness, aptitude, faculty, wherewithal, experience, skill, skillfulness, talent, flair, know-how

mean.noun: a roughly circular line, route, or movement that starts and finishes at the same place.
mean.verb: move all the way around (a place or thing).

synonym.noun: track, racetrack, raceway, running track, course

mean.noun: a group of similar buildings or facilities on the same site.
mean.verb: make (an atom or compound) form a complex with another.
mean.adjective: consisting of many different and connected parts.

synonym.noun: network, obsession, coordination compound, composite, building complex

words.example: Structural studies revealed that cullin serves as a bridge to bring together different components of the complex .

mean.noun: a part or element of a larger whole, especially a part of a machine or vehicle.
mean.adjective: constituting part of a larger whole; constituent.

synonym.noun: part, piece, bit, element, constituent, ingredient, building block, unit, module, section

mean.noun: an electronic device for storing and processing data, typically in binary form, according to instructions given to it in a variable program.

synonym.noun: personal computer, PC, laptop, netbook, ultraportable, desktop, terminal, mainframe, Internet appliance, puter

words.example: Participants scan the barcodes of every product they buy using a hand-held computer at home.

words.vietnamese: Văn bản chỉ bao gồm ký tự

mean.noun: a book or other written or printed work, regarded in terms of its content rather than its physical form.

words.example: Hoffman and Reilly squeeze all the legitimate, and many illegitimate, laughs out of the text .

mean.noun: the programs and other operating information used by a computer.

synonym.noun: software system, computer software, software package, package

words.example: The company develops software that mimics the human brain in the way that it works.

mean.noun: tools, machinery, and other durable equipment.

synonym.noun: equipment, apparatus, gear, paraphernalia, tackle, kit, machinery, tools, articles, implements, instruments, appliances

words.example: Global politics shift, military hardware and strategies are tried and tested and new forms of protest emerge.

mean.noun: a graphical item displayed on a screen or stored as data.
mean.adjective: of or relating to visual art, especially involving drawing, engraving, or lettering.

synonym.noun: picture, illustration, image, diagram, graph, chart, art, visual art

words.example: I've been told my work has an Asian feel, perhaps because of the graphic style and brushwork.

mean.noun: the action or method of storing something for future use.

words.example: the chair can be folded flat for easy storage

mean.noun: the fact or condition of functioning or being active.

synonym.noun: functioning, management, surgery, action, business, procedure, surgical procedure, mathematical operation, military operation, process

words.example: cleaning the high windows is a bit of an operation

mean.noun: the part of a computer in which data or program instructions can be stored for retrieval.

synonym.noun: ability to remember, recollection, commemoration, memory bank, storage, remembering, retentiveness

words.example: When the light pulse stops, its information is suspended and stored, just as information is stored in the memory of a computer.
